meanings.sent1: The car loan had an amortizable interest rate, making it easier to pay off over time.
meanings.sent2: The accountant explained that the equipment was amortizable and could be deducted over several years.
meanings.sent3: I wish my homework was amortizable, so I could gradually reduce the amount I have to do each day.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like an amortizable asset, slowly decreasing with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The idea of forgiveness is like an amortizable debt, diminishing as time goes by.

meanings.definition: Subject to gradual reduction or writing off.
meanings.sent1: The old building was considered amortizable due to its declining value over the years.
meanings.sent2: The company decided that the outdated technology was no longer amortizable and needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm for the project was amortizable, dwindling as the challenges increased.
meanings.sent4: The friendship felt like an amortizable bond, slowly fading with each disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood are like an amortizable treasure, diminishing as we grow older.
